Class Item

java.lang.Object
gamePackages.items.Item
Direct Known Subclasses:
Armor, ConsumableItem, Weapon
public abstract class Item extends Object
Represents a generic item in the game. The `Item` class serves as a base class for all specific item types. It includes basic attributes such as name, position, sprite, and texture, and defines abstract methods for behavior that must be implemented by subclasses.

  • Constructor Details

    • Item

      public Item()
      Default constructor for creating an uninitialized item.

    • Item

      public Item(String name, float posX, float posY, String spritePath)
      Constructs an item with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the item.
      posX - The X-coordinate of the item's position.
      posY - The Y-coordinate of the item's position.
      spritePath - The file path to the sprite texture for the item. This constructor initializes the item's attributes and creates its texture and sprite.

  • Method Details

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the item.
      Parameters:
      name - The name to assign to the item.

    • getType

      public abstract String getType()
      Gets the type of the item.
      Returns:
      A string representing the item's type. Subclasses must implement this method to define their specific type.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of the item.
      Returns:
      The name of the item.

    • getItemTexture

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture getItemTexture()
      Gets the texture of the item.
      Returns:
      The item's texture.

    • getItemSprite

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite getItemSprite()
      Gets the sprite of the item.
      Returns:
      The item's sprite.

    • use

      public abstract void use(Player player) throws Exception
      Uses the item, applying its effects to the specified player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player on whom the item is used.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs while using the item. Subclasses must implement this method to define the specific behavior of the item.
